name: Medupi Power Station
fundingSource: Government Guaranteed Bonds, DBSA, World Bank
description: 4,764MW coal-fired power station in Lephalale, Limpopo. Six 794MW units. Final unit commissioned March 2021. Project experienced significant delays and cost overruns from R96bn original estimate.

name: Kusile Power Station
fundingSource: Government Guaranteed Bonds, PIC, DBSA, Export Credit Agencies
description: 4,800MW coal-fired power station in eMalahleni, Mpumalanga. Eight 800MW units. All units commissioned by June 2024. World's third largest coal power station. FGD (flue gas desulphurisation) technology installed.

name: Koeberg Life Extension Project
description: Life extension of Koeberg Nuclear Power Station Unit 1 (to 2044) and Unit 2 (to 2045). Steam generator replacement and major component upgrades. Provides 1,900MW of low-carbon baseload capacity.

name: Eskom Just Energy Transition - Coal Mine Worker Programme
fundingSource: JET Investment Plan (EU, UK, USA, France, Germany), World Bank, DBSA
description: Social programme to retrain and re-employ workers and communities affected by coal power station decommissioning. Targets 100,000 direct and indirect workers. Skills development, SMMEs and renewable energy employment creation.

name: Renewable Energy IPP Grid Connection Programme
description: Transmission and distribution grid upgrades to connect 14,000MW of new renewable energy from REIPPP Rounds 5 and 6 plus bid window 7. Includes substation upgrades and new 400kV lines in Northern Cape and Eastern Cape.

name: Eskom Distribution Grid Modernisation
description: Modernisation of 40,000km of medium voltage distribution network including smart meters, SCADA upgrades and network automation to reduce unplanned outages and non-technical losses.

name: Eskom Smart Prepaid Metering Rollout
description: Installation of 2.8 million smart prepaid meters in Eskom supply areas to reduce electricity theft, improve revenue collection and enable remote monitoring. Targets R4.2bn annual revenue improvement.

name: Transnet NDP - Port of Durban Expansion
description: Multi-decade expansion of Port of Durban including Durban Container Terminal Pier 1 and Pier 2 upgrades, Cruise Terminal, Dig-Out Port (Durban-dig-out port) feasibility studies and equipment procurement.

name: Transnet Locomotive Procurement Programme (CRRC)
fundingSource: Export Credit Facility (China Exim Bank), DFI Loans
description: Procurement of 1,064 electric and diesel locomotives from CRRC (China South Rail Corporation). 232 diesel and 832 electric units. 40-50% local content requirement. 624 units delivered by October 2024.

name: Transnet Manganese Export Corridor Expansion
fundingSource: Eurobonds, DFI, Iron and Manganese exporters (take-or-pay)
description: Expansion of manganese export corridor from Hotazel in Northern Cape to Port Elizabeth from 10Mtpa to 16Mtpa. New locomotives, line upgrades and Port Elizabeth terminal expansion.

name: Transnet New Multi-Product Pipeline (NMPP) Rehabilitation
description: Rehabilitation and integrity management of the New Multi-Product Pipeline from Durban to Johannesburg. 580km pipeline carrying petrol, diesel and jet fuel. Capacity increase to 600 megalitres per day.

name: Transnet Port of Cape Town Expansion
description: Expansion of Cape Town Container Terminal to increase capacity from 900,000 TEU to 1.5 million TEU per annum. New cranes, yard equipment and reefer points for citrus export season.

name: SAA Fleet Rejuvenation Programme
fundingSource: Government Equity, IDC Facility, Aircraft Financing (AFIC)
description: Acquisition of 10 Airbus A320neo narrow-body aircraft to replace ageing Boeing 737-800s and A320ceos. First delivery expected Q2 2026. 20% fuel efficiency improvement per seat mile. Reduces average fleet age to 9.2 years.

name: SAA International Route Reinstatement
description: Reinstatement of 12 key international routes including JNB-LHR, JNB-MUM, JNB-EZE, JNB-SYD and African regional routes to Nairobi, Dakar, Lagos and Accra. Codeshare agreements with Air France-KLM and Singapore Airlines.

name: SAA Digital Transformation Programme
description: Implementation of new Passenger Service System (PSS), Revenue Management System and digital customer experience platform. Replace legacy Amadeus system. Target R650m annual IT cost reduction.

name: Denel Rooivalk Combat Helicopter Export Programme
fundingSource: Customer Advance Payments, ECIC Export Credit
description: Manufacturing and export of Rooivalk attack helicopters under multi-year export contract. 5-year contract. Production at Denel Aviation, Kempton Park. SANDF pilot training included. First delivery due Q3 2025.

name: Denel LMT Artillery System Partnership
description: Licensed production partnership with Latvian manufacturer LMT for wheeled and tracked artillery systems at Denel Land Systems. Target African export market. 80% local content. R8bn revenue over 7 years.

name: Denel Manufacturing Facility Modernisation
description: Modernisation of key Denel manufacturing facilities including Swartklip Products, PMP and Denel Dynamics. CNC machinery upgrades, safety improvements, test range refurbishment and environmental compliance works.

name: Denel SANDF Ammunition Supply Programme
description: 3-year ammunition supply contract with SANDF for small arms, artillery, mortar and naval ammunition at R1.2bn per annum. Critical for SANDF operational readiness and Denel revenue stability.

name: Transnet Port of Richards Bay Coal Terminal Upgrade
fundingSource: DFI Loans, Coal Exporters Take-or-Pay Facility
description: Upgrade of Richards Bay Coal Terminal to increase throughput capacity to 100Mtpa and extend operational life by 15 years. New stackers, reclaimers and conveyor systems.

name: Eskom Transmission HVDC Line - Mozambique
description: High Voltage Direct Current (HVDC) transmission line from the Mozambique hydro-power corridor to the South African grid. 1,800MW capacity enhancement for southern Africa regional grid integration.

name: Transnet Durban Dig-Out Port
description: New 16 million TEU container port at the South Durban Basin dig-out port location. Phase 1 capacity 2.5 million TEU by 2032. Would make Durban the largest port in Africa. Environmental impact assessment underway.

name: SAA Lounge Refurbishment Programme
description: Refurbishment of SAA's Johannesburg (JNB) Baobab Business Class Lounge, Cape Town lounge and key regional lounges. New food service, Wi-Fi infrastructure and spa facilities to compete with international carriers.

name: Eskom Solar Home System Rural Electrification
description: Off-grid solar home systems for 400,000 rural households beyond the economic grid extension reach. 6.4kWh systems providing lighting, charging and basic appliances. Reduces diesel generator dependence in rural areas.

name: Denel Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) Development
description: Development of next-generation indigenously designed unmanned aerial vehicle system for SANDF surveillance and reconnaissance missions. Partnership with Denel Dynamics and Aerospace Systems. Target 2,000km range.

name: Transnet Saldanha Iron Ore Terminal Expansion
fundingSource: Kumba Iron Ore Take-or-Pay, DFI Loans
description: Expansion of Saldanha Bay Iron Ore Terminal capacity from 60Mtpa to 75Mtpa including new reclaimer, conveyor upgrades and vessel loading equipment. Iron ore corridor from Sishen mine upgrade included.
